twice a week, just like now.
(starts to go, stops,
more money)
And make sure James gets what he
needs. And something for you.
He adds another bill. She smiles.

Views, open space, expensive furnishings. Hull (in another 

               fancy suit) is hanging a couple of Betty's masks. He's 

               meticulous about their placement.

               Elias wanders out from the other rooms, looking around.
(impressed, envious)
Hull has a moment of self-consciousness about the suit, checks himself out in a mirror -- a private moment. Elias flops on a couch, puts his feet on an antique coffee table.

dialogue.text: Hull has a moment of self-consciousness about the suit, checks himself out in a mirror -- a private moment. Elias flops on a couch, puts his feet on an antique coffee table.

segments.content: He hurries over, lifts Elias feet to the floor. Hull brushes the wood, inspects it carefully, fusses, worries... Elias is amused.

dialogue.text: He hurries over, lifts Elias feet to the floor. Hull brushes the wood, inspects it carefully, fusses, worries... Elias is amused.

segments.content: You pick all this shit out yourself?
A Jewish lady in the store helped
me.
(mock touched by racial
harmony)
Aw... Very nice. Understated. I'm
impressed.
Hull starts to place stacks of cash in a briefcase. He's
momentarily mesmerized by all the money.
(to himself)
Fifty bucks, fifty fucking bucks...
Hull nods.

dialogue.text: Hull nods.

segments.content: (continuing)
I'll order a couple more keys from
Barbosa.
Order ten.
Ten??
Better twenty.
(afraid of that)
I don't want to push it.
I do. We've got a bigger territory,
we need more product. I want to deal
directly with Gallegos. It would
save us money.
Hull closes the briefcase, ushers Elias toward the door. He's going out, too.

character.name: Barbosa'll never let us near him.

dialogue.text: Hull closes the briefcase, ushers Elias toward the door. He's going out, too.

segments.content: If we buy twenty, Gallegos'll come
to us himself.
How do you know?
When I bought a key from Eddie, you
came to me.
Elias laughs, surprised, afraid.
(continuing)
Who's above Gallegos?
Guzman, but he's... Don't ask so
many questions.
How else will I learn?
(hint of a threat)
Call Barbosa, David, put in our
order... Because we have to split
this, and there isn't enough here
for both of us.
Elias feels the threat.

Despite the CLOSED sign, a light's on inside. Hull knocks. 

               No response. He keeps knocking without let-up until:
(annoyed)
He knocks harder. Finally she appears in the doorway, stopping short when she sees it's him. She's immediately aware of white streaks on her grey suit. she tries to brush them off.

dialogue.text: He knocks harder. Finally she appears in the doorway, stopping short when she sees it's him. She's immediately aware of white streaks on her grey suit. she tries to brush them off.

segments.content: (doesn't want to let
him in)
Hull holds up the briefcase. She sighs, unlocks the door. INT. BETTY'S OFFICE - NIGHT A bill counter toting up the cash. She watches it fixedly to avoid looking at him, but she feels the chemistry.

character.name: Look, I'm tired, why don't you...

dialogue.text: Hull holds up the briefcase. She sighs, unlocks the door. INT. BETTY'S OFFICE - NIGHT A bill counter toting up the cash. She watches it fixedly to avoid looking at him, but she feels the chemistry.

segments.content: Why do you look at me like that?
How do I look at you?
Like you know something I don't.
That catches Hull off-guard, and he responds with a candor she didn't expect.

dialogue.text: That catches Hull off-guard, and he responds with a candor she didn't expect.

segments.content: I don't think I'm better than you. I
don't think I'm better than anybody.
She's startled by this remark and instinctively drawn to
him.
(continuing)
But I do know something... You can't
stop thinking about me.
Embarrassed, she looks away. He takes her hand, and at his
touch something yields to her. She lets him draw her to him.
His kiss is strangely tender, searching. It turns Betty on
incredibly. She melts into him.

She leads him into... THE SMALL OFFICE She's sweet and loving, but her sweetness scares her. He's all over her, but she pulls back for a moment. There is a couch and before it a coffee table with coke scattered on a plate.

dialogue.text: She leads him into... THE SMALL OFFICE She's sweet and loving, but her sweetness scares her. He's all over her, but she pulls back for a moment. There is a couch and before it a coffee table with coke scattered on a plate.

segments.content: (indicates coke)
She offers him a straw. He doesn't take it.

character.name: Do this... do it with me.

dialogue.text: She offers him a straw. He doesn't take it.

segments.content: (continuing)
This is where I'm at. You want to be
with me, it's gotta be there.
I don't do that.
Never have, never will.
It's for fuck-ups.
What do you think, you're not a
nigger? You're a nigger as much as
me.

She's angry, hurt, confused, wants to love him, but feels he won't let her, or she won't let herself. It's torment. Finally she's released by a KNOCK on the door. She goes out to... THE FRONT OF THE STORE Lets in Elias. He smells the tension.

dialogue.text: She's angry, hurt, confused, wants to love him, but feels he won't let her, or she won't let herself. It's torment. Finally she's released by a KNOCK on the door. She goes out to... THE FRONT OF THE STORE Lets in Elias. He smells the tension.

segments.content: (amused, jealous)
Having fun?
(neither answers; to
Hull)
I talked to Barbosa. He'll see us
now.
Hull turns to Betty. Both want to go that way instead of
this, but events are leading somewhere else. He follows Elias
out.
MUSIC pouring into the darkness.

Kids dancing to a live STAGE ACT. High in a wall: a lit 

               window.

Very different from the club. A comfortable room with a bar, 

               tables, filled with men much older than the dancers below. 

               Barbosa and Gopher at the bar with Elias and Hull. Chino and 

               other SHADOWY FIGURES lurk in the room's depths.
Ten kilos? You're always late on
two.
Barbosa's impressed.

dialogue.text: Barbosa's impressed.

segments.content: (continuing)
The more we have, the more we can
move. There're markets we can't open
because we don't have the inventory.
Barbosa's coked to the eyeballs, mean and dangerous.
Finally some balls on this team...
(taunting Elias)
Come work for me, John. I'll give
you your own franchise. You can supply
Elias, lean on him when he's late.
Barbosa laughs.

dialogue.text: Barbosa laughs.

segments.content: I'm with David.
Why? He give you his "designer drugs"
pitch. He's never going to do it.
He's a shmuck.
Don't talk to me that way.
I'm not talking to you at all. I'm
talking to John.
It's the cocaine. Don't listen to
him. Felix, you've had enough...
Elias goes for him. He's fast and strong, and it takes Chino and Hull to pull him off.

dialogue.text: Elias goes for him. He's fast and strong, and it takes Chino and Hull to pull him off.

segments.content: Praise God they don't let guns in
here.
"None of that in here..." "Take it
outside..."
Barbosa's laughing, but his cheek is flecked with his own
blood, and his eyes are dead.
David, you've been working out, you're
getting strong. Are you quick, too?
(shadow boxes)

heading.subject: Come on, I'll give you a shot at me.
heading.raw_text: Come on, I'll give you a shot at me.

segments.content: Any time, any place.
He puts his hands out, palms up.

character.name: Right here, right now. Do this.

dialogue.text: He puts his hands out, palms up.

segments.content: This? What is this?
You know, you slap me, I slap you.
(mimes that game)
It doesn't look fun. Elias glances at Hull for guidance.

character.name: Come on, it's fun. Like summer camp.

dialogue.text: It doesn't look fun. Elias glances at Hull for guidance.

segments.content: Don't waste your time.
Stay out of this.
(to Elias)
Come on, you can do it, David, you're
not a shmuck.
Elias puts his hands out, palms up. Barbosa covers them with
his own. ON THE HANDS: Barbosa's broad, muscular with thick
gold rings and a Rolex; Elias's paler, slighter, a wedding
band and a slim watch.
(continuing)

Elias looks Barbosa in the eye. He's trying to be a snake, but he's more the mouse. He looks away and as he does tries to... Slap him with both hands but hits only... Air. The room breathes. Barbosa turns his rings so the big surfaces point down.

character.name: Slap my hands. Just slap them.

dialogue.text: Elias looks Barbosa in the eye. He's trying to be a snake, but he's more the mouse. He looks away and as he does tries to... Slap him with both hands but hits only... Air. The room breathes. Barbosa turns his rings so the big surfaces point down.

segments.content: (continuing)
Now it's my turn.
It's Barbosa's turn. He's gonna kill
the white boy.
One more.
No, you went, Davey, now it's my
turn. First to four wins, like the
Elias covers Barbosa's palms with his own.

dialogue.text: Elias covers Barbosa's palms with his own.

segments.content: ON THE HANDS: Barbosa tenses his hands. Elias yanks back. Barbosa's hands haven't moved.

dialogue.text: ON THE HANDS: Barbosa tenses his hands. Elias yanks back. Barbosa's hands haven't moved.

segments.content: You remember the rules? If you flinch,
He slaps Elias across the face. Hull starts forward. A knife appears. He stops.

dialogue.text: He slaps Elias across the face. Hull starts forward. A knife appears. He stops.

segments.content: (continuing)
Elias covers Barbosa's hands. Barbosa tenses. Elias holds firm, and Barbosa quickly slaps both hands, hard. Elias doubles over, holding his hands in pain.

dialogue.text: Elias covers Barbosa's hands. Barbosa tenses. Elias holds firm, and Barbosa quickly slaps both hands, hard. Elias doubles over, holding his hands in pain.

segments.content: One.
That was two.
He slaps him again, a stinging crack. Elias looks to Hull, but they're across a canyon. Hull lowers his eyes.

dialogue.text: He slaps him again, a stinging crack. Elias looks to Hull, but they're across a canyon. Hull lowers his eyes.

segments.content: ON THE HANDS. Barbosa moves his hands a millimeter, and Elias flinches again. Barbosa smacks him across the face. The sound reverberates through the room. Now even Gopher is silent. Tears run from Elias's eyes, blood from his mouth, but he doesn't move.

character.name: Oh, and it hurts. Mercy, it hurts.

dialogue.text: ON THE HANDS. Barbosa moves his hands a millimeter, and Elias flinches again. Barbosa smacks him across the face. The sound reverberates through the room. Now even Gopher is silent. Tears run from Elias's eyes, blood from his mouth, but he doesn't move.

segments.content: (continuing)
Three.
A MAN steps forward out of the shadows. He is young, mid-30's, handsome, European features, beautifully dressed, accompanied by a guard we'll know as MOLTO. Someone murmurs to someone else:

dialogue.text: A MAN steps forward out of the shadows. He is young, mid-30's, handsome, European features, beautifully dressed, accompanied by a guard we'll know as MOLTO. Someone murmurs to someone else:

segments.content: Hull reacts. Their eyes meet.

dialogue.text: Hull reacts. Their eyes meet.

segments.content: The fight is over! The Ambassador
from the South has spoken!
(refusing any mercy)
Barbosa shakes his head, ashamed now in front of Gallegos.

dialogue.text: Barbosa shakes his head, ashamed now in front of Gallegos.

segments.content: (continuing)
One more! We're not finished!
(people are silent)
He holds out his hands. Barbosa resumes the stance, then waits, waits, waits, and finally brings both hands down, terribly hard, the sound of the slap is awful.

dialogue.text: He holds out his hands. Barbosa resumes the stance, then waits, waits, waits, and finally brings both hands down, terribly hard, the sound of the slap is awful.

segments.content: Four.

Hull leads Elias to the door right past Gallegos. Their gazes meet again. As they go out they hear Gallegos BERATING Barbosa in furious Spanish. INT. STAIRCASE - NIGHT Trembling, Elias holds his bloody hands against his chest, as Hull leads him in silence down the steps.

dialogue.text: Hull leads Elias to the door right past Gallegos. Their gazes meet again. As they go out they hear Gallegos BERATING Barbosa in furious Spanish. INT. STAIRCASE - NIGHT Trembling, Elias holds his bloody hands against his chest, as Hull leads him in silence down the steps.

segments.content: He barely whispers, but it's like a shout. Hull, who'd been avoiding his gaze, forces himself to look. Elias's humiliation is so profound it almost ennobles him. Finally:

character.name: Look at me. Look at me, damn it!

dialogue.text: He barely whispers, but it's like a shout. Hull, who'd been avoiding his gaze, forces himself to look. Elias's humiliation is so profound it almost ennobles him. Finally:

segments.content: Why did you do it?
I needed it. They taught me what I
needed to know. That I'm not part of
them, and I never will be. That they
don't respect me. That I don't deserve
respect. Because I'm a shmuck, John.
He laughs a terrible laugh. The door behind them opens, and Barbosa appears with Gopher. Everyone is ready for death, but:

dialogue.text: He laughs a terrible laugh. The door behind them opens, and Barbosa appears with Gopher. Everyone is ready for death, but:

segments.content: David, I'm sorry. It's a crazy time,
and... you know... I'm doing a little
too much coca... I'll buy your kid a
pony... anything you want... Let's
forget about it.
He comes down the stairs, offers his hand. Elias will never
forget about it, but he silently takes the hand, holds them
in his own bloody paws, looking directly into Barbosa's face.
Barbosa becomes uneasy, manages to extract his hand. Elias
and Hull continue down and out the door. Gopher gushes to
Barbosa.
I am so proud of you. You can be
cruel, and you can be kind. And just
now you were kind. Proud, proud, and
more proud. That's me.
INT. BOXING GYM - NIGHT Barbosa, Gopher with Hernandez, Taft's partner. Now we know Hernandez is corrupt: that's how they knew Eddie was talking.

dialogue.text: INT. BOXING GYM - NIGHT Barbosa, Gopher with Hernandez, Taft's partner. Now we know Hernandez is corrupt: that's how they knew Eddie was talking.

segments.content: I got nothing to give you, my man.
I'm an il-liquid son of a bitch.
Felix, I keep telling them, "I have
informants down there, I'm working
guys, I can't say who..." If you
don't have money, give me busts, or
they're gonna start wondering about
me.
They're already wondering.
(deadpan)
You can have Gopher.
Oh Gawd...
How about a lawyer?
(knows who he means)
Felix, don't do this.
(he knows, too)
Great, lawyers are great, Jewish is
best. But I need spades, too. The
politicians want dark facts to scare
the suburbs so they'll vote
Republican.
Lawyers and spades; I got the
trifecta: two dealers and a girl who
does their wash. Two niggers and a
kike; all Democrats.
Hernandez rubs thumb against fingers.

dialogue.text: Hernandez rubs thumb against fingers.

segments.content: When this is over, I'll send you to
Hawaii, Maui. It's very beautiful in
Maui, it's a very spiritual place.
And he's gone.

dialogue.text: And he's gone.

segments.content: I wouldn't trust that man when he's
out of rifle range.
Barbosa looks tired.
(continuing;
premonition of
disaster)
Don't do this, Felix. It'll go wrong.
Kill Elias if you have to, honey,
but don't set him up for this. It
damages your prestige.
Barbosa faces his cocaine. He tries to resist the pull, then
yields. He does another line. It's his friend. He loves it.
He picks up a cellular phone, dials.
David, you're awake, I'm impressed...
I'm sorry about what happened...
Listen, I'll get you twenty boxes,
like you wanted. You were right, you
should have what you need... Tomorrow
night... Bring your partner and that
girl with the store, Betty... I need
her advice on something. I want us
to have fun, like we used to. We'll
go to that shrimp place, okay?...
Good... Me, too, David.
(hangs up; does another
line; drawing it
deep into him)
INT. CARVER'S OFFICE - BEFORE DAWN Hull jacked up, excited, pleased with himself. As he paces, Carver observes his beautiful suit, shoes, expensive watch. He looks much better than Carver.

dialogue.text: INT. CARVER'S OFFICE - BEFORE DAWN Hull jacked up, excited, pleased with himself. As he paces, Carver observes his beautiful suit, shoes, expensive watch. He looks much better than Carver.

segments.content: We're getting twenty kilograms
tomorrow.
(notes the lightening
sky)
Tonight. I made it happen. I pushed
Elias, now he doesn't make a move
without me.
You run Elias.
I control him. Barbosa's selling it
to us because he thinks I can move
it...
(now the big news)
Carver sits up fast. Hull likes that.

character.name: And last night I met Ramon Gallegos.

dialogue.text: Carver sits up fast. Hull likes that.

segments.content: (continuing)
We're getting the dope from him;
it's still coming through Barbosa,
but Gallegos will approach me soon
on his own. We're going to get him,
Gerry. We're going to bring him and
the whole thing down.
Carver sits back, grimaces.
(continuing)
What's your problem?
(looking out window)
My problem? My problem is that you
don't really know what's happening.
(sardonic)
Oh, so, tell me what's happening,
Gerry.
Barbosa is setting you up tonight.
Bullshit.
He's dealing you to Taft and
Hernandez. You're going to be taken
down as you receive the drugs. They're
putting together the arrest team
right now.
That rocks Hull. He is up, pacing.
What do we do?
You stay away. We're going to take
them down.
Who? Elias and Betty? Don't be silly.
My boss wants a bust right now. He
goes before the oversight committee
next week. He needs something to
justify the budget.
(imploring)
I'll get him something. Give me ten
days, and I'll get him Gallegos on a
plate.
Too late. The whole thing's set up.
Gerry, what are you telling me? I
need Elias... and Betty. You arrest
them, and you're throwing away
everything I've set up.
Hull walks out.

dialogue.text: Hull walks out.

segments.content: (continuing)
EXT. 96TH STREET NEAR THE AIRPORT/INT. A CAR - NIGHT Elias (no sleep) driving. Betty in front. Hull in back.

character.name: John, don't go near that bust.

dialogue.text: EXT. 96TH STREET NEAR THE AIRPORT/INT. A CAR - NIGHT Elias (no sleep) driving. Betty in front. Hull in back.

segments.content: We shouldn't go to them. Maybe them
come to us.

They pull into the lot of a boarded up restaurant where Barbosa and Chino stand outside of a limousine. EXT. BEHIND AN AIRPORT MOTEL - NIGHT Taft and Hernandez in the same van that was outside the gym earlier. They're watching THROUGH BINOCULARS, night scopes. They spot Elias's car.

dialogue.text: They pull into the lot of a boarded up restaurant where Barbosa and Chino stand outside of a limousine. EXT. BEHIND AN AIRPORT MOTEL - NIGHT Taft and Hernandez in the same van that was outside the gym earlier. They're watching THROUGH BINOCULARS, night scopes. They spot Elias's car.

segments.content: (whispering into radio)
Here they are. Nobody move until we
see the green suitcase.
The two groups meeting. Barbosa gives Betty a courtly kiss.
(flirtatious)
I'm sorry for dragging you out so
late, but I have to be careful.
HULL watching planes descend into the airport, nervous. He knows what's coming, but how does he handle it?

dialogue.text: HULL watching planes descend into the airport, nervous. He knows what's coming, but how does he handle it?

segments.content: Elias takes a satchel out of the rent-a-car trunk. Chino opens the limousine's trunk. Inside is an over-sized day-glo green plastic suitcase. He is about to pick it up.

dialogue.text: Elias takes a satchel out of the rent-a-car trunk. Chino opens the limousine's trunk. Inside is an over-sized day-glo green plastic suitcase. He is about to pick it up.

segments.content: (continuing; spotting
the police van in
the adjacent lot)
Everyone looks at him, then the direction he's looking.

dialogue.text: Everyone looks at him, then the direction he's looking.

segments.content: What is this?
Something's wrong. What's that van
doing there?
Everyone looks. They can barely see the van. Hull pulls a
gun.
(continuing)
This is a bust. The minute we take
the stuff, they'll be over us.
He's crazy, David. I thought you
were the crazy one, but it's him.
Hull puts the gun to Barbosa's head, addresses Chino:
Chino, pick up the suitcase and give
it to Elias. I'll only kill him if
something goes wrong.
Chino moves to pick up the suitcase.
Everyone looks at Hull amazed, even Chino.

dialogue.text: Everyone looks at Hull amazed, even Chino.

segments.content: (softly)
Fucking A, John...

He throws the money in the limo truck, slams the lid. He's running the show now, and everyone knows it. He's winging it, but confident and strangely calm. Elias, energized by Hull's command, grabs Barbosa and throws him toward the limo. HERNANDEZ'S POV THROUGH NIGHT SCOPE

dialogue.text: He throws the money in the limo truck, slams the lid. He's running the show now, and everyone knows it. He's winging it, but confident and strangely calm. Elias, energized by Hull's command, grabs Barbosa and throws him toward the limo. HERNANDEZ'S POV THROUGH NIGHT SCOPE

segments.content: We have a problem.
Shit! Shit! Shit!
(aiming rifle; Hull
in sights)
Enough of this...
EXT. TWO CARS - NIGHT Hull shepherding everyone into the limo. He glances toward the van. On instinct. He pulls Chino to him. A RIFLE SHOT Chino's head explodes. Betty screams.

dialogue.text: EXT. TWO CARS - NIGHT Hull shepherding everyone into the limo. He glances toward the van. On instinct. He pulls Chino to him. A RIFLE SHOT Chino's head explodes. Betty screams.

segments.content: (screaming at van)
INT. VAN - NIGHT Taft hurling Hernandez against the wall.

dialogue.text: INT. VAN - NIGHT Taft hurling Hernandez against the wall.

segments.content: Goddam it, what the hell are you
doing?

SIRENS. GUNFIRE. Elias drags Barbosa into the limo. Hull 

               throws Betty into the front seat. The limo takes off.

Hull driving, Betty up front. Elias with a gun on Barbosa in 

               back. Hull slaloms the limo through police GUNFIRE. Windows 

               are blown out. Glass everywhere.
(weeping)
I asked for this... I asked for it...
It's my fault...
(calm, eyes on road)
She looks at him, stunned yet soothed by his certainty.

dialogue.text: She looks at him, stunned yet soothed by his certainty.

segments.content: He's a cop. He has to be. How else
would he have known?
If I was cop, you'd be face down
back there.
How did you know?
The whole thing smelled. Changing
his mind about the stuff. Meeting us
way out here. And I'd seen cops in
that van before. Hernandez is dirty,
that's who he's using.
(to Barbosa)
He starts to open the door.

dialogue.text: He starts to open the door.

segments.content: David, not now.
INT. TAFT AND HERNANDEZ'S CAR - NIGHT Racing. Taft at wheel, raging at Hernandez.

dialogue.text: INT. TAFT AND HERNANDEZ'S CAR - NIGHT Racing. Taft at wheel, raging at Hernandez.

segments.content: Who are you, man? Who the fuck are
you?
(stonewalling)
INT. LIMO - DRIVING - NIGHT

dialogue.text: INT. LIMO - DRIVING - NIGHT

segments.content: He traded us to the cops. Just like
Eddie. Eddie, who was nice to my
daughter, had to die because that's
the rule. And you were vulgar about
my wife, Felix, so at the very least
the same rule applies to you.
I'll give you money. I'll give you a
million. Anything you want.
I want you to get out of the car.
Get out of the fucking car. Out of
the fucking --
(near tears)
No, no... we can't do this.
(turning around from
front seat)
Elias wheels on him, sticks the gun in his face:

dialogue.text: Elias wheels on him, sticks the gun in his face:

segments.content: (in a fury)
He holds them up: swollen, black and blue, cut up.

dialogue.text: He holds them up: swollen, black and blue, cut up.

segments.content: (continuing; to
Barbosa, softly)
Barbosa's frozen. Elias grabs his hand, SHOOTS a bullet through. Barbosa screams...

dialogue.text: Barbosa's frozen. Elias grabs his hand, SHOOTS a bullet through. Barbosa screams...

segments.content: No!
Elias wheels on them, swinging the gun from one to the other.

dialogue.text: Elias wheels on them, swinging the gun from one to the other.

segments.content: Stay out of this, or you'll die.
His fury makes anything seem possible. He pushes open the door. Trembling, Barbosa starts to climb out. The limo enters a tunnel, police still in pursuit. Halfway out, Barbosa stops.

dialogue.text: His fury makes anything seem possible. He pushes open the door. Trembling, Barbosa starts to climb out. The limo enters a tunnel, police still in pursuit. Halfway out, Barbosa stops.

segments.content: Elias SHOOTS him in the butt. He shrieks, jerks forward. The cops are getting close behind. Other cops waiting at the far end of the tunnel. Hull hits the brakes, spins a 180 into the opposite lane. Barbosa is flung out of the car and plastered by a succession of fishtailing vehicles. Hull speeds back the other way. They're going straight at: INT. VAN - COMING STRAIGHT AT THEM - NIGHT Taft and Hull, the two drivers, lock eyes. It's chicken, but more than that. Two men set against each other who, for some reason, want to be friends. At the last instant, the van swerves away, but: ELIAS AIMING AT TAFT Taft sees the gun too late. He can do nothing. Hull's gaze follows Taft's. He sees Elias, deliberately swerves, sending the SHOT wild. INT. LIMO - RACING - NIGHT

Hull hits the brakes, spins a 180 into the opposite lane. Barbosa is flung out of the car and plastered by a succession of fishtailing vehicles. Hull speeds back the other way. They're going straight at: INT. VAN - COMING STRAIGHT AT THEM - NIGHT Taft and Hull, the two drivers, lock eyes. It's chicken, but more than that. segments.content: I had him!
You want to kill a cop?? Don't be
stupid.
The limo speeds away.

heading.subject: shot out. Hull and Betty silent, shaken. Elias
heading.raw_text: The windows shot out. Hull and Betty silent, shaken. Elias

segments.content: charged up, happy.
Everything is different. We're the
Colombians now.
(radiant)
This is the greatest night of my
life. Terrible but great. Felix was
right...
(appalled)
About what?
He said I should kill a man. He was
right.
My God.
Barbosa was a roach. Do you miss
him? Will anybody in the world miss
him?
Are you a roach, too?
(happily)
Yes. Thank God.
(to Hull)
He's silent, keeps driving. She's had enough.

dialogue.text: He's silent, keeps driving. She's had enough.

segments.content: (continuing)
Hull looks at her.

dialogue.text: Hull looks at her.

segments.content: (continuing)
He brakes to a stop. She jumps out, leans back in.

dialogue.text: He brakes to a stop. She jumps out, leans back in.

segments.content: (continuing)
No more laundering, no more anything.
And she disappears into the night. Elias watches her go. Hull resumes driving.

dialogue.text: And she disappears into the night. Elias watches her go. Hull resumes driving.

segments.content: She knows too much. We have to kill
her.
No! She's with me. She's not going
to talk.
(looks at Elias)
You touch her, I'll kill you.
Hull accepts it.

dialogue.text: Hull accepts it.

segments.content: (continuing)
We're going to get the money now,
John. Enough for the new drug. We're
going to be rich. We're going to be
so rich that we're going to leave
the world of ordinary people and
going to a higher realm. I mean that.
They're going to come after us.
(matter-of-fact)
It's a hardball game. We're hardball
players.

heading.raw_text: EXT. COMMERCIAL STREET - EAST L.A. - NIGHT

segments.content:
Hernandez comes out of a bodega with groceries, wine and a 

               woman. He nuzzles her as he lets her into his car. As he's 

               getting behind the wheel, Molto (Gallegos' guard) stops the 

               door from closing. The conversation is entirely in SPANISH.
It wasn't my fault.

He SHOOTS him in the head. Hernandez slumps against the wheel. The woman screams. Molto walks away. EXT. AN APARTMENT COMPLEX/INT. BETTY'S APARTMENT - DAWN Hull finds a door, pushes the buzzer. Betty looks through the glass. She's afraid of him.

dialogue.text: He SHOOTS him in the head. Hernandez slumps against the wheel. The woman screams. Molto walks away. EXT. AN APARTMENT COMPLEX/INT. BETTY'S APARTMENT - DAWN Hull finds a door, pushes the buzzer. Betty looks through the glass. She's afraid of him.

segments.content: Don't kill me. I'm not going to talk.

Then she looks closer and sees not murder in his face, but need. She opens the door. Without a word, he gathers her to him. She can't resist him now. Her mouth is everywhere on him. INT. HER BEDROOM - DAWN Betty gasping in the wake of pleasure, turning her face away from him, she feels so exposed.

dialogue.text: Then she looks closer and sees not murder in his face, but need. She opens the door. Without a word, he gathers her to him. She can't resist him now. Her mouth is everywhere on him. INT. HER BEDROOM - DAWN Betty gasping in the wake of pleasure, turning her face away from him, she feels so exposed.

segments.content: She hides her face in his neck. INT. SAME - LATER They lie in each other's arms, relaxed together for the first time. A wonderful, unprotected openness.

dialogue.text: She hides her face in his neck. INT. SAME - LATER They lie in each other's arms, relaxed together for the first time. A wonderful, unprotected openness.

segments.content: (softly)
Tell me about you.
(half-kidding)
Everything worth knowing you just
found you.
He laughs. They begin to make love again. Suddenly: AN EXTRA
HAND stroking Betty's hair. She gasps. A gun in Hull's ear.
Another in her face. Guns all around.

Hands pull him out of bed, leave her there alone. We see Molto, two or three others. EXT. A CEMETERY - MORNING RAMON GALLEGOS lays a bouquet of white lillies on a grave. He kneels, whispers a prayer, crosses himself. He rises and walks to where Molto and the other guards hold Hull and Elias. Gallegos is in his thirties, more European than Barbosa. He has a distinctly mild manner.

dialogue.text: Hands pull him out of bed, leave her there alone. We see Molto, two or three others. EXT. A CEMETERY - MORNING RAMON GALLEGOS lays a bouquet of white lillies on a grave. He kneels, whispers a prayer, crosses himself. He rises and walks to where Molto and the other guards hold Hull and Elias. Gallegos is in his thirties, more European than Barbosa. He has a distinctly mild manner.

segments.content: An impudent question, but Elias seems strangely bright-eyed despite the guns held on him.

dialogue.text: An impudent question, but Elias seems strangely bright-eyed despite the guns held on him.

segments.content: My wife's. She died of leukemia three
years ago.
(looks around)
I like to be among the dead. They
never interrupt you.
(turning to them)
Felix Barbosa started out as a skinny
fourteen-year-old fucking Yankee
businessman in Bogata hotels. He
grew up. He made himself strong and
rich, but getting there made him
sick, and that killed him. So he
lost everything for the same reason
he'd gotten it in the first place.
A PRIEST going by greets Gallegos who responds warmly. They chat a minute in SPANISH. The Priest leaves.

character.name: Now we'll see if you can do as well.

dialogue.text: A PRIEST going by greets Gallegos who responds warmly. They chat a minute in SPANISH. The Priest leaves.

segments.content: (continuing)
Felix owed me one million eight
hundred thousand dollars.
He addresses this to Hull; Elias feels left out.
(continuing)
When you killed him, you bought the
debt; now you owe it to me; you get
to keep thirty percent, like he did.
Gallegos turns to leave.

dialogue.text: Gallegos turns to leave.

segments.content: Who did Barbosa collect from?
If you don't know, you shouldn't
have killed him.
He notices Hull's earring: two tiny dice, the spots made of
minuscule jewels. Unembarrassed, he fingers it.
(continuing)

Without waiting for an answer, he yanks it out of Hull's ear and walks away, leaving Hull bleeding through his fingers before a stone cross. EXT. A GHETTO STREET - NIGHT A club on the corner. THROUGH A WINDOW we see a RAP ACT on the stage, their MUSIC pumping out onto the street. Hull pulls up in a Jaguar. He and Elias go through a door adjacent to the club. INT. BUILDING HALL/INT. GOPHER'S ROOM - NIGHT The MUSIC is still audible here, though muffled. Elias and Hull are pushing at door Gopher is trying to hold closed.

dialogue.text: Without waiting for an answer, he yanks it out of Hull's ear and walks away, leaving Hull bleeding through his fingers before a stone cross. EXT. A GHETTO STREET - NIGHT A club on the corner. THROUGH A WINDOW we see a RAP ACT on the stage, their MUSIC pumping out onto the street. Hull pulls up in a Jaguar. He and Elias go through a door adjacent to the club. INT. BUILDING HALL/INT. GOPHER'S ROOM - NIGHT The MUSIC is still audible here, though muffled. Elias and Hull are pushing at door Gopher is trying to hold closed.

segments.content: I don't want you in here. You killed
the man, and I loved him. I don't
want to have anything to do with
you.
Elias kicks it open, and they enter Gopher's tiny, miserable
domain. He's wearing some sort of negligee and an immense
naked woman fills his bed. We still hear the MUFFLED MUSIC.
(continuing; apoplectic)
I'm a sixty-three-year-old man! I'm
a grandfather! Would you hit a sixty-
three-year-old white man? Would you
hit your own grandfather?
(slaps him against
wall)
Listen, you fucking monkey, you know
who owed him money, and we know you
know. Tell us or --
Hull pulls him off. Elias is angry. They struggle.
Meaning: deal with me or deal with Elias.

dialogue.text: Meaning: deal with me or deal with Elias.

segments.content: The MUSIC continues OVER the following sequence: INT. CRACK HOUSE - DAY Elias arguing with a dealer. He slaps him around. TIGHT ON HANDS Money is exchanged. The money is stuffed in a satchel. INT. A LAW OFFICE - DAY A well-dressed lawyer (30's) talking with clients, a distinguished couple in their 60's. The door BANGS open and a secretary is unable to restrain Hull and Elias as they charge into the room. The lawyer is up on his feet, but Hull shoves him around as Elias politely explains to the clients that this will only take a moment. TIGHT ON SATCHEL Hull's hands thrust more money in. It's getting full. INT. A MOTORCYCLE REPAIR SHOP - NIGHT A biker in leathers on hands-and-knees spitting blood onto the cement floor. Hull stands over him, fists clenched. INT. A CAR TRUNK A satchel stuffed with money is latched, set next to another latched one. A third is opened, money and jewelry dumped in. EXT. STREET - NIGHT Hull looking into the trunk. Elias is beat.

character.name: You can't tell anyone it was me.

The money is stuffed in a satchel. INT. A LAW OFFICE - DAY A well-dressed lawyer (30's) talking with clients, a distinguished couple in their 60's. The door BANGS open and a secretary is unable to restrain Hull and Elias as they charge into the room. The lawyer is up on his feet, but Hull shoves him around as Elias politely explains to the clients that this will only take a moment. TIGHT ON SATCHEL Hull's hands thrust more money in. A CAR TRUNK A satchel stuffed with money is latched, set next to another latched one. A third is opened, money and jewelry dumped in. EXT. STREET - NIGHT Hull looking into the trunk. Elias is beat.

segments.content: Where the hell is all the money?
We're still a million short.
I gotta get laid.
David, we've got thirty-six hours.
(slams trunk, moves
toward door)
Pick me up at Jacqueline's in the
morning.
Elias gets in the car and drives off. Hull turns and a dark American sedan pulls up alongside. Carver behind the wheel.

dialogue.text: Elias gets in the car and drives off. Hull turns and a dark American sedan pulls up alongside. Carver behind the wheel.

segments.content: (an order)
INT. CAR - NIGHT

dialogue.text: INT. CAR - NIGHT

segments.content: (as he gets in)
What are you doing here? You're going
to get me killed.
Carver peels away fast. He's very angry, frightened, too,
but that's hidden.
Where the hell have you been?
There's an indifference to Carver's authority we haven't heard before. Hull isn't even aware of it, but Carver is.

dialogue.text: There's an indifference to Carver's authority we haven't heard before. Hull isn't even aware of it, but Carver is.

segments.content: You violated a direct order to stay
away from that bust. As a result, a
police informant is dead, a state
senator was critically injured in
the tunnel pile up and a city
policeman was subsequently murdered.
I didn't blow my cover.
Don't get smart with me, motherfucker.
Don't be a shmuck, Gerry. I'm talking
to Gallegos. I'm collecting his money.
We can set him up right now.
(NOTE: Carver arrives
somewhere and parks.
To be discussed, but
let's say, for now,
that we are:)

heading.raw_text: EXT. SANTA MONICA PARKING STRUCTURE - OVERLOOKING OCEAN -

segments.content:
They get out of the car. Carver takes out a flask, has a 

               drink, offers it to Hull who declines.
Never have, never will.
(puts the flask away)
I want you to give me your gun. You're
coming in right now.
(doesn't understand)
Coming in where?
Your assignment has been terminated.
You're not going out there again. If
I have to, I'll put you in custody.
(uncomprehending)
I'm going to have Gallegos in two
days.
Carver says nothing. Suddenly Hull understands.
(continuing)
You're protecting him. You're
protecting Gallegos.
Carver snorts: ridiculous.
(continuing)
No, of course. That's why you wanted
to bust Elias and Betty. I was getting
close, and you wanted to cut this
off then... What is he, the new
Noriega? Helps you fight commies, so
you let him sell drugs to the niggers.
Two birds with one stone.
You violated orders, so you're
through. Don't make a conspiracy
theory out of it.
(laughs)
I'm through...? Then, I might as
well have a drink after all.
Surprised, Carver reaches for the flask. As he does, Hull
grabs him, pushes him out over the edge of the building,
holds him there.
(continuing)
Now tell me the truth or they're
going to decide your troubles got
the best of you.

heading.subject: s.
heading.raw_text: Carver struggles. Hull pushes him out farther. Carver dangles.

segments.content: You're insane.
All the more reason to do what I
say. Jesus, Ger, I'm having trouble
holding on...
All right!
Say it!
Hull pulls him back in. Carver slumps against the wall, drinks greedily. Hull lets him for a moment, then takes the flask away.

dialogue.text: Hull pulls him back in. Carver slumps against the wall, drinks greedily. Hull lets him for a moment, then takes the flask away.

segments.content: (continuing)
I told you, Gallegos's uncle is a
big deal down there.
Guzman.
Guzman, right. Our government supports
Guzman because he's a moderate. That's
a right-winger who's pro-U.S.
(he doesn't like it
either)
If Gallegos got busted here, it would
hurt Guzman's political career there.
It's politics, John, not drugs.
Drugs is politics. Politics is
drugs...
(sickened)
Christ, Gerry, I dealt drugs. I killed
a man. Others died. What did I do
all this for? For nothing.
I'm going to Washington, John. I'll
bring you with me. We'll have clout,
money...
(outraged)
I didn't do this for clout or money.
You said we were gonna do some good.
We tried.
Trying's for college boys.
(his head on fire)
If all there is is power and money...
If all there is... then what am I
doing here? 'Cause I can get more
power and money out on the street, I
got more there already, than I'd
ever get kissing your ass in
Washington...
But you can't do that, John. It's
not you.
Me? There is no me. We took care of
that. First I was a cop pretending
to be a dealer. Now I'm just a dealer
pretending to be a cop. Why not stop
pretending...? Quit the force. Be a
dealer.
It's not that simple.
My assignment's already terminated.
All I have to do is quit. I hereby
quit.
(lifts the flask)
My first one.
(drinks)
He slips the flask in his pocket, gets in the car, starts engine.

dialogue.text: He slips the flask in his pocket, gets in the car, starts engine.

segments.content: Hull drives off, leaving Carver alone on the roof. INT. BETTY'S APARTMENT - NIGHT She lets him in, sees the distress in his face.

dialogue.text: Hull drives off, leaving Carver alone on the roof. INT. BETTY'S APARTMENT - NIGHT She lets him in, sees the distress in his face.

segments.content: He shakes his head, drops onto the couch. He takes out the flask, offers it to her. She shakes her head.

dialogue.text: He shakes his head, drops onto the couch. He takes out the flask, offers it to her. She shakes her head.

segments.content: He laughs, takes a drink. She's surprised, says nothing.

dialogue.text: He laughs, takes a drink. She's surprised, says nothing.

segments.content: Tell me.
Tell you what?
What you came to say.
What did I come to say?
Then tell me anything. Something
about you. Something real.
(long beat; another
drink)
When I was young, I occasionally
stole things.
(laughs to himself)
My father died when I was ten. Right
in front of me.
The revelation is so sudden it surprises Hull as much as
Betty.
(continuing)
Heart attack. He just fell down. He
said, "I love you," then died in my
arms.
She holds him, and he lets himself be held.

dialogue.text: She holds him, and he lets himself be held.

segments.content: (continuing)
Tell me what's going on, John?
(doesn't want to talk
about that)
You're not doing the stuff anymore,
are you?
Pulls playfully at her nose.
No. Don't change the subject.
How is that?
It's hard. John...!
(trying to tell without
telling)
Things are getting, they're getting
a little... confusing. I had certain
plans, and people haven't come through
exactly as they promised.
What do you expect with those people?
(laughs)
It's not just those people. It's...
it's bigger than that. It's of
everybody. Present company excluded.
You've got to stop this, John, you
know that. You gotta get out.
I can't.
Of course, you can.
(almost angry)
No! This is what I'm supposed to do.
Supposed to? Who said you're supposed
to?
The whole fuckin' world. You think I
didn't try something else? But
everything funnels you right back
here. Like it's where you had to go
all along.
But you know what you're doing, don't
you, selling this stuff? Doing to
our own.
If I tried to get out now, they'd
kill me.
(tortured)
I can't be with somebody's who
involved in drugs.
He nods. He knows. He's even happy about it. But she won't
yield. Finally he gets up and walks back out the door.

The neighborhood is reminiscent of the one where Joe Stevens 

               Sr. was killed. The rap club still pumps MUSIC onto the 4 

               A.M. streets where whores, junkies, children, teenagers with 

               beepers and Nikes, welfare mothers roam as if it were daytime 

               anywhere else. Their eyes, yearning, sullen, vital, hopeless 

               and hoping stare at...

Everyone knows what he is: the Black Man with the Big Car. 

               They don't remember when he was just another hustler making 

               street buys. Now they hate him, revere him, want to be him, 

               not caring what it entails. Every eye follows as...

               He and Elias cross the street toward Gopher's door. Hull's 

               eyes don't go right or left. He's a driven man now.

Gopher has just been roused from sleep. A light in his face, 

               Hull and Elias looming over him.
There've got to be more. We have a
million two, we owe Gallegos one
eight.
I told you everyone. Everyone who
owed him, everyone he... One eight?
He's lying. Barbosa barely owed him
a million.
Hull and Elias look at each other.

Taft is showing her photocopies of phone bills, bank 

               transactions, invoices. She's obviously upset.
I got every money transfer, every
phone call, all your laundry tickets.
(miserable)
What do you want?
John Hull.
I can't!
Or you'll go away 'til you're a dried
up old woman, and when you come out,
ain't nobody gonna want you.
She covers her face.

heading.raw_text: EXT. EAST L.A. STREET/INT. CAR - DAY

segments.content:
Elias driving a car we haven't seen before and snickering to 

               himself at some private joke.

Elias shakes his head: nothing. He laughs. They pull into the lot beside a movie theater. INT. THEATER - DAY A Technicolor Spanish melodrama is winding to its lurid end. A door in back opens, and a burst of daylight reveals Hull and Elias being brought in by a guard and met by Molto. Molto and the guard frisk them, take their guns and money satchels, make them wait a moment until... The movie ends. The house lights come on revealing Ramon Gallegos as the only spectator in the theater. He beckons. Molto and the guard bring Hull and Elias down the aisle to him. Gallegos looking in the satchels. A tense moment.

dialogue.text: Elias shakes his head: nothing. He laughs. They pull into the lot beside a movie theater. INT. THEATER - DAY A Technicolor Spanish melodrama is winding to its lurid end. A door in back opens, and a burst of daylight reveals Hull and Elias being brought in by a guard and met by Molto. Molto and the guard frisk them, take their guns and money satchels, make them wait a moment until... The movie ends. The house lights come on revealing Ramon Gallegos as the only spectator in the theater. He beckons. Molto and the guard bring Hull and Elias down the aisle to him. Gallegos looking in the satchels. A tense moment.

segments.content: It isn't one eight.
(off Gallegos)
It's a million one. That's all Barbosa
owed, it's all we're paying.
Gallegos is stern for a moment, then laughs.
Big brass balls. Collecting money
makes you strong.
Everybody relaxes. Gallegos scribbles something on a piece
of paper, hands it to the guard who feeds it into a fax
machine.
What's that?
I'm telling our suppliers they got
paid. They'll be very happy. I'm
happy.
And we're happy. Everybody's happy.
Elias seems a bit mad, but no one minds. He and Hull are ready to go. He gestures to Molto, wants his gun back.

dialogue.text: Elias seems a bit mad, but no one minds. He and Hull are ready to go. He gestures to Molto, wants his gun back.

segments.content: So, how can I express my gratitude
for a job well done?
Gallegos gestures to Molto to give them the guns.

dialogue.text: Gallegos gestures to Molto to give them the guns.

segments.content: Done. Of course.
And, also, your business. All this.
Hull looks at Elias; what's going on?

dialogue.text: Hull looks at Elias; what's going on?

segments.content: (smiles)
You're tougher than I thought, but
not that tough.
He brings up the gun and SHOOTS Gallegos in the head. Hull and the guards are frozen. Then everyone goes for a gun. Elias SHOOTS the guard. Hull has his gun to Molto's head and screams at Elias:

dialogue.text: He brings up the gun and SHOOTS Gallegos in the head. Hull and the guards are frozen. Then everyone goes for a gun. Elias SHOOTS the guard. Hull has his gun to Molto's head and screams at Elias:

segments.content: Meaning don't shoot him. But Elias has no intention of doing so.

dialogue.text: Meaning don't shoot him. But Elias has no intention of doing so.

segments.content: (breathless)
Thank you, John. I couldn't have
done that without you.
(barely able to speak)
He can't believe it: the guy he's been after the whole time is dead on the floor.

dialogue.text: He can't believe it: the guy he's been after the whole time is dead on the floor.

segments.content: You taught me to take my work
seriously.
What's going on here, David?
We're taking over.
You're doing too much stuff.
No, I'm very clear. I'm very, very
clear.
(to Molto)

Molto nods. EXT. THEATER PARKING LOT/INT. CAR - DAY Hull, Elias and Molto getting into their car. Molto is recalcitrant. Elias pistol whips him. Hull stops him. EXT. SAN FERNANDO VALLEY/INT. CAR - DAY The car passes through a development of suburban homes. They enter a driveway. Two boys play in the yard.

dialogue.text: Molto nods. EXT. THEATER PARKING LOT/INT. CAR - DAY Hull, Elias and Molto getting into their car. Molto is recalcitrant. Elias pistol whips him. Hull stops him. EXT. SAN FERNANDO VALLEY/INT. CAR - DAY The car passes through a development of suburban homes. They enter a driveway. Two boys play in the yard.

segments.content: (to Molto)
Molto is silent. Elias FIRES a bullet right between his feet. Molto jumps. The boys turn. Hull grabs the gun away. We feel the toll Elias's madness is taking on him.

dialogue.text: Molto is silent. Elias FIRES a bullet right between his feet. Molto jumps. The boys turn. Hull grabs the gun away. We feel the toll Elias's madness is taking on him.

segments.content: What the fuck's the matter with you?

And, indeed, Molto is pointing to a Winnebago parked at the rear of the property. EXT. REAR OF PROPERTY - DAY Winnebago. With a tire iron, Hull snaps off the padlock that holds the rear door closed. He opens the door. Money gushes out. He slams it closed.

dialogue.text: And, indeed, Molto is pointing to a Winnebago parked at the rear of the property. EXT. REAR OF PROPERTY - DAY Winnebago. With a tire iron, Hull snaps off the padlock that holds the rear door closed. He opens the door. Money gushes out. He slams it closed.

segments.content: He, Elias and Molto are on hands and knees scooping it up. SAME - LATER Molto tied to a tree. Elias is giving him instructions while, strangely, removing Molto's shoes and socks.

dialogue.text: He, Elias and Molto are on hands and knees scooping it up. SAME - LATER Molto tied to a tree. Elias is giving him instructions while, strangely, removing Molto's shoes and socks.

segments.content: (to Molto)
Disce a Senor Guzman que...
(his Spanish isn't
good enough)
...that we have his money, and we're
willing to talk as soon as he comes
to town. We'll know how to reach
him. Okay?
Molto just glares at him. Elias smiles, takes the shoes and
socks and all the contents of Molto's into the Winnebago,
and he and Hull drive away, leaving the car behind.

heading.raw_text: EXT./INT. A PARKING GARAGE/INT. WINNEBAGO - EVENING

segments.content:
The Winnebago enters the garage, Elias greeting the attendant, 

               "Hey, Frank." Frank waves him in.

               The garage is filled with various RVs. Hull pulls the 

               Winnebago into an empty spot beside Elias's car and gets 

               out. Elias remains in the cabin making calculations.
Approximating the cubic capacity and
depending on the denominations of
the bills, it's somewhere between
fifty million and two hundred million
dollars. Right back there.
As he does, Hull checks his gun, walks around behind the
vehicle and prepares to shoot Elias in the back of the head
through the open window. Elias finishes his money report,
and sits there as if unaware of Hull, but:
(continuing; not
turning around)
Think I'm crazy?
Yes.
(blowing up, gun still
on him)
I can't believe you got us into this.
All of fucking Latin America is going
to be after our asses, including
Renaldo Guzman who's friends with
fucking George Bush.
I know they're coming after us. I
want them to. We'll give them the
money, but we'll make a deal for
ourselves. We'll get what we need
for the synthetic drugs. I've thought
it all out. I've been thinking it
out for years.
Hull uncocks the gun, rubs it against his burning face. Elias
turns around, embraces him.
(continuing)
We're going to have everything. Don't
you want everything, John?
They're going to get your family,
David. They'll kill your wife and
daughter.
(serene)
Nancy and Miranda left the country
two days ago.
Elias smiles.

dialogue.text: Elias smiles.

segments.content: (continuing)

EXT. BETTY'S JEWELRY SHOP - EVENING A car SQUEALS to a stop. Molto and three thugs smash through the glass door. They disappear into the store where things can be heard BREAKING. They emerge a moment later, jump into the car. EXT. SYNAGOGUE - EVENING Hull's car races up. He jumps out, dashes toward the building. INT. SYNAGOGUE SOCIAL HALL - EVENING Forty PEOPLE on folding chairs. Hull enters on a dead run. He stops short when he sees: BETTY at the front. He signals to her, but she's already saying:

dialogue.text: EXT. BETTY'S JEWELRY SHOP - EVENING A car SQUEALS to a stop. Molto and three thugs smash through the glass door. They disappear into the store where things can be heard BREAKING. They emerge a moment later, jump into the car. EXT. SYNAGOGUE - EVENING Hull's car races up. He jumps out, dashes toward the building. INT. SYNAGOGUE SOCIAL HALL - EVENING Forty PEOPLE on folding chairs. Hull enters on a dead run. He stops short when he sees: BETTY at the front. He signals to her, but she's already saying:

segments.content: Hi, my name is Betty.
Hi, Betty!
My name is Betty, I'm a drug addict.
And I've been clean for nineteen
days.
The room bursts into APPLAUSE. She sees Hull at the back; he
signals to her, but she goes on.
(continuing)
I've been using drugs and selling
them, and I've wanted to stop for a
long time, and the only way I did
was because I met a man I loved and
who loved me. I know that's not what
I'm supposed to say. I'm supposed to
say there was a higher power, and
maybe there was, behind it all, but
this man is strong and his love made
me strong enough that I could start,
or at least think about a life that
didn't have drugs in it...
She's looking right at Hull as she speaks. He's torn between
the danger he knows she's in and his emotion at what she's
saying.
Hull hurrying Betty toward his car. She's protesting.
I've got to get clothes.

INT. HULL'S CONDO - EVENING Molto and men pouring through it. In frustration, Molto smashes the table Hull had fussed over when Elias put his feet up. EXT. MOTEL COURTYARD - NIGHT Hull and Betty hurry toward his room carrying shopping bags, a newly bought suitcase. They see... COPS They freeze, turn, ready to bolt. But more cops behind them. A panic, yet no one's coming after them. They walk on. The cops are going into and coming out of Belinda's room. INT. BELINDA'S ROOM - NIGHT The fat Blonde Woman is talking to a policewoman. James sits on the bed staring at... BELINDA who lies dead on a floor littered with crack vials. Hull picks up a vial, holds it up to the Blonde Woman with a question.

dialogue.text: INT. HULL'S CONDO - EVENING Molto and men pouring through it. In frustration, Molto smashes the table Hull had fussed over when Elias put his feet up. EXT. MOTEL COURTYARD - NIGHT Hull and Betty hurry toward his room carrying shopping bags, a newly bought suitcase. They see... COPS They freeze, turn, ready to bolt. But more cops behind them. A panic, yet no one's coming after them. They walk on. The cops are going into and coming out of Belinda's room. INT. BELINDA'S ROOM - NIGHT The fat Blonde Woman is talking to a policewoman. James sits on the bed staring at... BELINDA who lies dead on a floor littered with crack vials. Hull picks up a vial, holds it up to the Blonde Woman with a question.

segments.content: (nodding)
She got a fever and just burned up.
She just burned up all of a sudden.
It must have been bad stuff.
(indicating James)
He shouldn't be here.
(takes his hand)
Come on, James, we'll go get a
burrito.
The boy allows himself to be led out. Betty looks at Hull
who's in a private hell.

Hull and Betty are about to enter Hull's room. The door is 

               ajar.

Taft stands at the dresser. He's found Hull's collection of 

               memorabilia and is looking at the photo of his children.
Cute kids...
(angry at the invasion)
He snatches away the photo, but not before Betty sees it. She reaches out her hand. He reluctantly turns it over to her.

dialogue.text: He snatches away the photo, but not before Betty sees it. She reaches out her hand. He reluctantly turns it over to her.

segments.content: Tell me something, who the fuck are
you?
Hull doesn't answer, collects the rest of his things,
including the bloody money, stuffs it back in the envelope.
(continuing)
'Cause I don't think you're quite
the asshole you're trying to be.
Look, Mr. Taft, that's your name,
right? Leave me alone. I got things
on my mind.
I'd think you would. You better have
your goddamn life on your mind, or
it's gonna get away from you. It's
gonna burn up like that poor woman
across the way. Like all of you's
gonna burn...
And what do you do, Mr. Taft, except
chase bad guys up and down the street
with your dirty partner, never
catching anybody important?
I do what I can. Do you do what you
can?
(Hull says nothing)
Maybe my partner was dirty. Maybe
the chief's dirty. And the mayor.
And the President. Maybe God Himself's
taking something on the side. That's
their problem. But I'll bust 'em if
I can.
(without force)
Get out of my room.

He leaves. Hull turns to Betty who is still holding the photo of his children. He gently takes it, looks at it, seems to draw both succor and pain from it. He gets out Carver's flask and tries to drink, but it's empty.

dialogue.text: He leaves. Hull turns to Betty who is still holding the photo of his children. He gently takes it, looks at it, seems to draw both succor and pain from it. He gets out Carver's flask and tries to drink, but it's empty.

segments.content: They're my children. They live in
Cleveland with their mother. I'm
divorced from her. I haven't seen
them in... some time. I want to, but
I haven't been able to arrange it.
How much else don't I know about
you?
(trying to make a
joke)
Everything else... Everything else
is... I don't know.
Taft has all the evidence about my
laundering.
Hull's upset.
He's going to put me in jail for a
long time unless I give you up.
Do it.
I can't. So, I've got to get away.
Far away. But I need money.
(laughs)
He empties his pockets of all that gushed out of the Winnebago, empties a satchel as well until it fills the room like snow. EXT. MOTEL - NIGHT Hull putting Betty into an airport limousine.

dialogue.text: He empties his pockets of all that gushed out of the Winnebago, empties a satchel as well until it fills the room like snow. EXT. MOTEL - NIGHT Hull putting Betty into an airport limousine.

segments.content: (to the driver)
International terminal.
(to Betty)
She kisses him. He's about to close the door. She stops it.

character.name: I'll meet you there in a week.

dialogue.text: She kisses him. He's about to close the door. She stops it.

segments.content: You know the first time, when I saw
you in the bar...?
(smiles at the memory)
You wouldn't even look at me.
'Cause I knew what you were thinking.
You were judging me.
No, I wasn't, I was...
You were. Your eyes were like an
angel in my heart telling me I should
be good, and I didn't want to hear
it.
This news startles Hull, yet, strangely, he senses its truth,
and the sweetness is more than he can bear.
(continuing)
That's you, too. Maybe this is you,

She closes the door. The car pulls away. In an unmarked car up the street, Taft picks up the radio. EXT. A LATIN AMERICAN CONSULATE - DAY A limousine pulls into the gate and disgorges RENALDO GUZMAN, 55, and his wife, 25. They're shown into the consulate. The limousine pulls out onto the street and parks. Gopher appears, knocks on the driver's window. It comes down. They chat briefly in Spanish. Gopher opens up a cellular phone. INT. A HOTEL ROOM - SANTA MONICA - DAY Overlooking the ocean. Hull pacing nervously, Elias relaxed, reading the paper.

character.name: I don't know, but I know that's you.

dialogue.text: She closes the door. The car pulls away. In an unmarked car up the street, Taft picks up the radio. EXT. A LATIN AMERICAN CONSULATE - DAY A limousine pulls into the gate and disgorges RENALDO GUZMAN, 55, and his wife, 25. They're shown into the consulate. The limousine pulls out onto the street and parks. Gopher appears, knocks on the driver's window. It comes down. They chat briefly in Spanish. Gopher opens up a cellular phone. INT. A HOTEL ROOM - SANTA MONICA - DAY Overlooking the ocean. Hull pacing nervously, Elias relaxed, reading the paper.

segments.content: What if we forget all this? Take ten
million each and disappear. Leave
the country. New identities, new
lives...
What's the matter, John? Having
doubts?
A phone RINGS. Elias picks up his own cellular.

dialogue.text: A phone RINGS. Elias picks up his own cellular.

segments.content: Yes... Where?... No! No way... We
pick the time and place... Otherwise
no meet...
(looks to Hull who
nods his agreement)

EXT. CONSULATE - LIMO - DAY Gopher hands a piece of paper to the limo driver. He walks away... AROUND THE CORNER As he's about to get into a car, Taft grabs him. Gopher is surprised and not pleased. EXT. PARKING GARAGE - NIGHT Where Hull and Elias left the Winnebago. Guzman's limo approaches. Frank, the attendant, waves it on. INT. GARAGE - NIGHT The limo climbs the ramps until it comes to Elias's car, parked where the Winnebago was; the Winnie is nowhere in sight. The limo pulls alongside. Hull and Elias get out. Molto gets out of the limo. Then Renaldo Guzman.

dialogue.text: EXT. CONSULATE - LIMO - DAY Gopher hands a piece of paper to the limo driver. He walks away... AROUND THE CORNER As he's about to get into a car, Taft grabs him. Gopher is surprised and not pleased. EXT. PARKING GARAGE - NIGHT Where Hull and Elias left the Winnebago. Guzman's limo approaches. Frank, the attendant, waves it on. INT. GARAGE - NIGHT The limo climbs the ramps until it comes to Elias's car, parked where the Winnebago was; the Winnie is nowhere in sight. The limo pulls alongside. Hull and Elias get out. Molto gets out of the limo. Then Renaldo Guzman.

segments.content: We have a proposal to make. We regret
what happened to your nephew...
Say what you have to say.
We all know that your cousin's
business is coming to an end. Costs
have climbed while profits and the
market --

heading.subject: Guzman waves: get to the point.
heading.raw_text: Guzman waves: get to the point.

segments.content: (continuing)
We have developed a new product:
simpler, cheaper to manufacture,
superior quality and completely
synthetic. Therefore, no growing, no
refining, no peasants, no importing,
no customs agents... Here's a detailed
prospectus with anticipated cash
flow and so forth.
He hands a copy to Guzman and the lawyer.
(to Molto, teasing
Elias)
The racist Americans just want to
cut us poor Hispanics out of the
market.
There are no Americans anymore, Mr.
Guzman, you know that. No Hispanics,
no Japanese, no blacks, no whites,
no anything. There are only rich
people and poor people. We're rich,
so we're on the same side.
Taft with Gopher in his car.
Do they have money in there?
I don't know.
Gopher shrugs; a decision: Taft picks up his radio.

dialogue.text: Gopher shrugs; a decision: Taft picks up his radio.

segments.content: (continuing)
INT. GARAGE - NIGHT

dialogue.text: INT. GARAGE - NIGHT

segments.content: We're prepared to give you 80% of
the money. The remainder you invest
in our business with proceeds paid
out according to the figures there.
He indicates the prospectus that Guzman has been looking
through.
This looks interesting. I'd have to
confirm everything, of course. Do
you have a sample of the product?
Elias produces one. Guzman gestures to Molto. Molto samples
it. Molto's eyes widen.
Buy it!

Elias hands him a key, points to a different Winnebago. Molto takes the key, unlocks the back: money. He signals okay to Guzman. Suddenly: SIRENS. Police cars wail into the garage. The THWACK- THWACK and sweeping light of a helicopter descend toward the roof (though we never see the copter).

dialogue.text: Elias hands him a key, points to a different Winnebago. Molto takes the key, unlocks the back: money. He signals okay to Guzman. Suddenly: SIRENS. Police cars wail into the garage. The THWACK- THWACK and sweeping light of a helicopter descend toward the roof (though we never see the copter).

segments.content: (continuing; anger)
You set this up.

Everybody scatters. The garage is a labyrinth of cement stairwells, ramps, hundreds of RVs to hide between, under and so forth... Lots of NOISE, lights, but mostly we see Hull and Elias dodging here, avoiding the action. INT. ANOTHER PART OF THE GARAGE - NIGHT Molto caught between the lights. He draws his gun. GUNFIRE. He's cut down.

dialogue.text: Everybody scatters. The garage is a labyrinth of cement stairwells, ramps, hundreds of RVs to hide between, under and so forth... Lots of NOISE, lights, but mostly we see Hull and Elias dodging here, avoiding the action. INT. ANOTHER PART OF THE GARAGE - NIGHT Molto caught between the lights. He draws his gun. GUNFIRE. He's cut down.

segments.content: (screaming)

EXT. PARKING GARAGE - NIGHT Cars with rotating dome lights, but not many cops. Hull and Elias emerge from a shadowy doorway and make their way at a casual pace beyond the perimeter of police cars, quickly mingling with other spectators. They continue down... EXT. A QUIET SIDE STREET - NIGHT Strolling now. Elias elated, uncontained joy.

character.name: Where are the rest of them?

dialogue.text: EXT. PARKING GARAGE - NIGHT Cars with rotating dome lights, but not many cops. Hull and Elias emerge from a shadowy doorway and make their way at a casual pace beyond the perimeter of police cars, quickly mingling with other spectators. They continue down... EXT. A QUIET SIDE STREET - NIGHT Strolling now. Elias elated, uncontained joy.

segments.content: We did it. Twenty million. Twenty
fucking million. We're going to have
synthetics. We're gonna be rich.
Hull stops walking and just stands there.

dialogue.text: Hull stops walking and just stands there.

segments.content: (continuing)
What's the matter, John? Be happy.
Your whole life has just been solved.
(behind them)
In one motion, Elias draws his gun, turns and FIRES. The figure goes down. Elias can't believe he hit him. Hull starts toward the figure.

dialogue.text: In one motion, Elias draws his gun, turns and FIRES. The figure goes down. Elias can't believe he hit him. Hull starts toward the figure.

segments.content: (heading the other
way)
Taft -- on the ground.

dialogue.text: Taft -- on the ground.

segments.content: He drops to his knees. Blood oozes from Taft's chest.

dialogue.text: He drops to his knees. Blood oozes from Taft's chest.

segments.content: John, what the hell are you doing?
Hull tries to hold closed the wound. The posture duplicates Hull with his dying father. He feels for a pulse. For breath.

dialogue.text: Hull tries to hold closed the wound. The posture duplicates Hull with his dying father. He feels for a pulse. For breath.

segments.content: (distraught)
He's dying.
Let him die. Let him die twice. Come
one.
He pulls at Hull who won't go. Hull does mouth-to-mouth.
Taft opens his eyes, looks up at him.
[Says to Taft whatever a CPR-trained
policeman would say in this
situation.]
(to Elias)
Get help.
Are you kidding me?
(to Hull, getting it)
Oh, man, you're a cop. You're a cop,
aren't you?
(with difficulty, as
if against his will)
Yeah, I'm a cop. I'm a fucking cop...
(laughs)
Oh, really? Where's you badge?
I don't have one. I'm undercover.
Get help, David.
John, that's a cop. He tried to kill
you.
He didn't know.
Oh, he didn't know. I don't know.
Maybe you don't know. Maybe you think
you're a cop because... because...
Drop the gun, put your hands against
the car. Spread your legs... Police!
Taft grunts once, stiffens.
(continuing)
The pulse is gone. Hull begins to perform CPR.

dialogue.text: The pulse is gone. Hull begins to perform CPR.

segments.content: Okay, let's say you're a cop. Be a
cop.
Hull keeps doing CPR.
(continuing)
We've still got the money. We put it
into Randy's chemistry set. In five
years we're worth five hundred million
each, minimum. You'll be one of the
richest black men in America. Richer
than Cosby. Who gives a shit how you
got it? You think the white ones
were honest?
Hull keeps working on Taft.
(continuing)
Is this asshole all that stands
between you and greatness? Let me do
you a favor.
He puts a gun to Taft's head and FIRES. In a reflex, Hull
draws his own gun, SHOOTS Elias in the stomach. Stunned, he
wobbles backward a few steps. Sits on the street.
(continuing)
Gee, John, that's kind of an extreme
reaction.
Hull is stunned he did it. And this finally attracts the

heading.subject: police who see a black man with a gun who just shot a white
heading.raw_text: police who see a black man with a gun who just shot a white

segments.content:
man.

               Hull goes to Elias who's dead. A POLICEMAN pulls him off, 

               beating him with a gun.
INT. LOS ANGELES COUNTY JAIL - DAY Hull, bandaged, wearing prison blues, walking with Carver.

dialogue.text: INT. LOS ANGELES COUNTY JAIL - DAY Hull, bandaged, wearing prison blues, walking with Carver.

segments.content: What about Guzman?
He vanished, thank God, or we'd both
be in deep doo-doo. At least you got
Gallegos.
Elias did. And everything goes on as
before.
That's the drug game. Plus a change...
I want you to come back to work for
me. You'll beat all charges on a
technicality and go back to who you
were.
Who was I, Ger?
Does anyone really know?
I have other things to do.
Hull looks at him; how did he know?

dialogue.text: Hull looks at him; how did he know?

segments.content: (continuing)
He beckons him. He walks him over to a cell. Through a one- way window they see: BETTY alone in the cell, unaware she's being watched.

dialogue.text: He beckons him. He walks him over to a cell. Through a one- way window they see: BETTY alone in the cell, unaware she's being watched.

segments.content: Go back to work, she walks out of
here. Otherwise, she's up on multiple
counts, and I'll see to it the judge
runs them consecutively.
Hull just looks at him. Carver shrugs apologetically.

Absolutely white. Not a window, not a stick of furniture. 

               The only deviation is Hull in prison blues.

               The door opens, Betty comes in wearing prison yellows. She 

               sits on a nearly invisible chair. They know they're being 

               watched.
They want me to testify against you.
I said I wouldn't.
You have to. It's all set up. That's
how you're getting off.
She shakes her head in cynical understanding. How difficult
it is to get back to an honorable life.
He takes her hand.
(continuing; with
difficulty)
She looks at him.

character.name: My father didn't have a heart attack.

dialogue.text: She looks at him.

segments.content: (continuing)

heading.subject: He was shot robbing a liquor store.
heading.raw_text: He was shot robbing a liquor store.

segments.content: Trying to rob it. I lied about that.
Baby, why are you telling me this?
I had to start somewhere... There're
other things you don't know...

heading.subject: AN IRIS SHOT
heading.raw_text: AN IRIS SHOT - HULL AND BETTY

segments.content:
Silent. Kissing. Beginning to make love. Hull extracts 

               himself, gives the finger to the POV and stuffs a bit of 

               tissue in the iris, blocking our view.
Carver takes his eye from the now obscured peephole.

A funeral. Taft's wife and children (from the wallet photo) 

               leave the graveside with the rest of the funeral party.

               When everyone is gone, Hull approaches the grave. From his 

               pocket, he removes the four blood-soaked bills his father 

               gave him, and wedges these among the stems of flowers that 

               already cover the plot.

               He's silent a moment, then he gets up. He joins Carver who's 

               standing with Hull's children. The kids each take his hand, 

               they walk together.
Betty walked out of court free this
morning. That's my side of the deal.
(to the children)
They do. Hull watches them go.

dialogue.text: They do. Hull watches them go.

segments.content: Her probation gets revoked the minute
you fuck up. I want you to stay away
from her altogether.
You know the difference between a
black man and a nigger?
Carver smiles, shakes his head. He likes a good joke. Hull
punches him so hard in the stomach that he goes to his knees.
(continuing)
The nigger's the one who'd even think
about doing what you tell him.
He walks away. Still on his knees, doubled over, Carver
whispers after him:
FADE OUT.

dialogue.text: FADE OUT.
